data.chText: 发生的事情；（尤指）重要事情，大事
data.enText: a thing that happens, especially sth important

data.chText: 那次选举是2004年的主要大事。
data.enText: The election was the main event of 2004.

data.chText: 从后来发生的事看，这一决定证明是正确的。
data.enText: In the light of later events the decision was proved right.

data.chText: 我们现在作出的决定可能会对未来事情的发展产生影响。
data.enText: The decisions we take now may influence the course of events (= the way things happen) in the future.

data.chText: 人人都因接二连三发生的怪事感到惊恐。
data.enText: Everyone was frightened by the strange sequence of events .

data.chText: 要是事情发展顺利的话，她已同他一块儿走了。
data.enText: In the normal course of events (= if things had happened as expected) she would have gone with him.

data.chText: 公开活动；社交场合
data.enText: a planned public or social occasion

data.chText: 筹款活动
data.enText: a fund-raising event

data.chText: 本年度最重要的社交活动
data.enText: the social event of the year

data.chText: （体育运动的）比赛项目
data.enText: one of the races or competitions in a sports programme

data.chText: 800米赛是下午的第四项比赛。
data.enText: The 800 metres is the fourth event of the afternoon.
after the event

data.chText: 事情发生后；事后
data.enText: after sth has happened

data.chText: 事后聪明谁都会。
data.enText: Anyone can be wise after the event.
in any event
at all events

data.chText: 不管怎样；无论如何
data.enText: used to emphasize or show that sth is true or will happen in spite of other circumstances

data.chText: 我想她会同意做的，但无论怎样，她只能说“不”。
data.enText: I think she'll agree to do it but in any event, all she can say is ‘no’.
in the event

data.chText: 结果；到头来
data.enText: when the situation actually happened

data.chText: 我对考试提心吊胆，但其实我本不必担心，这次考试的确很容易。
data.enText: I got very nervous about the exam, but in the event, I needn't have worried; it was really easy.
in the event of sth
in the event that sth happens

data.chText: 如果…发生；万一；倘若
data.enText: if sth happens

data.chText: 万一发生事故就拨这个号码。
data.enText: In the event of an accident, call this number.

data.chText: 他一旦故去，所有财产都由希拉继承。
data.enText: Sheila will inherit everything in the event of his death.
in that event

data.chText: 如果是那样的话；如果那种事情发生
data.enText: if that happens

data.chText: 如果是那样的话，我们就得重新考虑我们的建议。
data.enText: In that event, we will have to reconsider our offer.
a happy event

data.chText: （生孩子）喜事
data.enText: the birth of a baby
be wise after the event

data.chText: 事后聪明；马后炮
data.enText: to understand sth, or realize what you should have done, only after sth has happened

simple_means.memory_skill: e 出 + vent 来 → 出来的事 → 事件

ex.chText: 这个小插曲使听众哄然大笑。
ex.enText: The incident made the listeners burst into laughter.

ex.chText: 很多政治事件都没有报道。

synonyms.bx: 可指小事件，也可指严重的、重要的或暴力的事件。

ex.chText: 今天早上发生了交通事故。
ex.enText: A traffic accident occurred this morning.

ex.chText: 我很抱歉打翻了你的咖啡杯——这是个意外。
ex.enText: I'm sorry about knocking over your coffee cup - it was an accident.

synonyms.bx: 指导致某人受伤或某物受损的事故，也可指并非有意造成的意外事件。

ex.chText: X射线的发现是物理学史上的重大事件。
ex.enText: The discovery of X-rays was a big event in the history of physics.

ex.chText: 结婚是他一生中的大事之一。
ex.enText: Getting married was one of the major events in his life.

synonyms.bx: 尤指重要的事件或大事，也可指有意思或不寻常的事件。

ex.chText: 一连串的倒霉事弄得他很心烦。
ex.enText: He was upset by a series of mishaps.

ex.chText: 她把那个贵重的花瓶弄坏了一点儿。
ex.enText: She had a slight mishap with the expensive vase.

synonyms.bx: 指影响不大的小事故或小错误。

ex.enText: Traffic jams are a common occurrence in that area.

ex.chText: 那个国家不常出现极端天气。
ex.enText: Extreme weather is a rare occurrence in that country.

synonyms.bx: 指生活中发生的一般的或偶然的事件。

data.enText: after the event

data.chText: 事情发生后；事后
data.enText: after sth has happened

data.chText: 事后聪明谁都会。
data.enText: Anyone can be wise after the event.
in any event
at all events

data.chText: 不管怎样；无论如何
data.enText: used to emphasize or show that sth is true or will happen in spite of other circumstances

data.chText: 我想她会同意做的，但无论怎样，她只能说“不”。
data.enText: I think she'll agree to do it but in any event, all she can say is ‘no’.
in the event

data.chText: 结果；到头来
data.enText: when the situation actually happened

data.chText: 我对考试提心吊胆，但其实我本不必担心，这次考试的确很容易。
data.enText: I got very nervous about the exam, but in the event, I needn't have worried; it was really easy.
in the event of sth
in the event that sth happens

data.chText: 如果…发生；万一；倘若
data.enText: if sth happens

data.chText: 万一发生事故就拨这个号码。
data.enText: In the event of an accident, call this number.

data.chText: 他一旦故去，所有财产都由希拉继承。
data.enText: Sheila will inherit everything in the event of his death.
in that event

data.chText: 如果是那样的话；如果那种事情发生
data.enText: if that happens

data.chText: 如果是那样的话，我们就得重新考虑我们的建议。
data.enText: In that event, we will have to reconsider our offer.
a happy event

data.chText: （生孩子）喜事
data.enText: the birth of a baby
be wise after the event

data.chText: 事后聪明；马后炮
data.enText: to understand sth, or realize what you should have done, only after sth has happened

tr: something that happens at a given place and time
a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
example: the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise
his decision had depressing consequences for business
he acted very wise after the event

tr: a phenomenon located at a single point in space-time
the fundamental observational entity in relativity theory

example: in that event, the first possibility is excluded
it may rain in which case the picnic will be canceled

value.def: An event is something that happens, especially when it is unusual or important. You can use events to describe all the things that are happening in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...in the wake of recent events in Europe...
example.tran: 紧随欧洲最近发生的大事之后

example.ex: A new book by Grass is always an event.
example.tran: 格拉斯的新书总能引起轰动。

value.tran: 事件;（尤指）特殊事件，重大事件

value.def: An event is a planned and organized occasion, for example a social gathering or a sports match.

example.ex: The cross-country section of the three-day event was held here yesterday.
example.tran: 3日比赛中的越野项目昨天在这里举行。

example.ex: ...our programme of lectures and social events.
example.tran: 我们的演讲和社交活动计划

value.tran: （社交聚会、体育比赛等有计划、有组织的）活动

value.def: An event is one of the races or competitions that are part of an organized occasion such as a sports meeting.

example.ex: A solo piper opens Aberdeen Highland Games at 10am and the main events start at 1pm.
example.tran: 上午10点，一位风笛独奏家揭开了阿伯丁高地运动会的序幕，下午1点主要比赛项目开始。

value.def: You use in the event of ,in the event that, and in that event when you are talking about a possible future situation, especially when you are planning what to do if it occurs.

example.ex: The bank has agreed to give an immediate refund in the unlikely event of an error being made...
example.tran: 万一出现错误——虽然这种几率微乎其微，银行同意立即退款。

example.ex: In the event that any part of the deal may be blocked, the rest would go ahead.
example.tran: 万一交易的某一部分受阻，其他部分将继续进行。

value.tran: 万一发生…；如果是那样子的话；假若…

value.def: You say in any event after you have been discussing a situation, in order to indicate that what you are saying is true or possible, in spite of anything that has happened or may happen.

example.ex: In any event, the bowling alley restaurant proved quite acceptable.
example.tran: 无论如何，那个保龄球场的餐厅证明还是很不错的。

value.def: You say in the event after you have been discussing what could have happened in a particular situation, in order to indicate that you are now describing what actually did happen.

example.ex: 'Don't underestimate us', Norman Willis warned last year. There was, in the event, little danger of that.
example.tran: “别低估了我们，”诺曼·威利斯去年警告说。结果，什么事也没有。

trans: 结果;到头来

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 加强 + vent 来 → 来到
advent 到来 + itious …的 →〔突然〕来到的 → 偶然的
ad 加强 + venture 冒险；冒险行动 → 冒险
adventur〔e〕冒险 + ous 有…性质的，关于…的 → 爱冒险的
a 加强 + ven 来 + ue → 让人们可以走来走去 → 大路
contra 反对；相反；对比 + ven 来 + e → 反着来 → 违反
con 共同 + ven 来 + e → 都来到一起 → 召集
con 共同 + ven 来 + ience 表状态 → 全部能来没有障碍 → 方便
con 共同 + vent 来 + ion 表名词 → 大家来到一起 → 集会
e 出 + vent 来 → 出来的事 → 事件
event 事件 + ful …的 → 事件多的 → 多变故的
partsOfSpeech.d: 发生许多事情的；多变故的

partsOfSpeech.dec: event 事件 + ual 有…性质的 → 出事〔之后〕→ 最终的
inter 在…之间 + ven 来 + e → 走到中间来 → 干涉
in 使… + vent 来 → 使…出来 → 发明出
in 进入 + vent 来 + ory 表物 → 进来的〔全部财产〕→ 财产清单
pre 预先 + vent 来 → 预先来到 → 抢先一步，防止别人先到 → 防止
re 回 + ven 来 + ue → 回来的东西 → 收入
ven 来 + ture 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 →〔危险〕来到 → 冒险
